author: Deleted User
content:
Some help here: I am playing with the spec using `u64` values

When we compute the FFG rewards with `get_base_reward(state, index) * attesting_balance // total_balance`

We get that if we assume the `attesting_balance` above to be the `total_balance` of `get_base_reward`, then at the first product we would be getting a `u64` overflow.

I made the following spreadsheet to test for some values (screenshot below): https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1h8p9_RzV7lnfaFYn_SwSR3KEvRv_tZ-XBsx_SnhIyUU/edit?usp=sharing

What I am overlooking here? Should I just switch to `i128`?

author: djrtwo
content:
yeah, you're right

wow, can't believe we missed that  , and thank you for finding it     <:eth2:595693639913570305>

author: djrtwo
content:
We discontinued our bounty program when we unfroze the phase 0 spec, but this certainly qualifies. You're the first bounty recipient. congrats :)

I'll reinstate the bounty program in about 2 weeks following the release of the post-audit spec release

author: djrtwo
content:
So get_base_reward returns values of about 14 bits 

1M is about 20 bits
10^9 is about 30 bits

author: djrtwo
content:
`process_slashings` has a mechanism for avoiding such an overflow
we'll parallel that code in the rewards

author: djrtwo
content:
.
We don't have huge v-sets in the test vectors because they make vector files huge, but we'll need to add something to catch this and maybe uncover similar issues.

We're also now doing a comprehensive review of calculations
